Look for some answers that you can lay out on a chess board. Knowing how chess boards are labeled will help.
You need to use the answers that are formed by two 8-letter words. The first letter of each word will help you place it on the chessboard.
Each pawn corresponds to a letter of the answer. Can you find an ordering to them?
There's only one way for the rook to take one pawn on each move and successfully take all the pawns.
